title: T-Shirt Script
content:
Can someone help with a start to this typeface or even style. Yes, I understand most of this is custom done.

I’ve found this...  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/blambot/skin-deep-bb/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825150028/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/blambot/skin-deep-bb/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/blambot/skin-deep-bb/")

Any other ideas?

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 10.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825150028/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2010_1.png) | 86.78 KB |

 [‹ Graphical House Logotype - Bold Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825150028/http:/typophile.com/node/48673 "Go to previous forum topic") [Can't find this anywhere. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825150028/http:/typophile.com/node/48664 "Go to next forum topic")
author: complexone

comments.content: Sweet. Thanks a ton. Very helpful

hmmm, this doesn’t look like it came from Sloop at all.

This one actually looks Custom, in other words, designed/drawn/built from scratch. In this case, it feels like it was done by hand, before it ended up on a T-shirt. It could be the handiwork of an LA artist/art director, Jose Soto.

If it was indeed based on Sloop’s outlines (adding flourishes to an existing font) ... you could call it Customized, or you could call it a Type Treatment.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825150028im_/http:/typophile.com/files/todiefor_6120.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080825150028im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sloop1_3460.jpg)
